Name: Dust 1947: Sturmluther/Stummel/Prinzluther
Description:
The SturmLuther is a walker troop transport, with dedicated antiaircraft firepower. One of the safest ways to get to the battlefield! The Stummel also transport troops, but with firepower designed to attack enemy infantry and light vehicles. Finally the PrinzLuther is the command version build on this chassis. It is armed with a very versatile rapid firing gun.
This reference allows you to field one of these three variants.

This reference comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, all for the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Gregor The Defector
Description:
Once part of the BlutKreuz Korps, he has now joined the ranks of the Mercenaries. A true war machine, Gregor is a beast in Close Combat and at longer range as well! He can be played with any army in the World of Dust and will be a great addition to any force!

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for the Mercenaries and one for the BlutKreuz Korps. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Magda & Pink Flamingo
Description:
A recovering pyromaniac, who also loves guns, Magda was a perfect match for the Mercenaries who sometimes have to go through crazy missions to get paid. And when crazy is on, Magda is on top of things. She has fought all over the World, on the hottest spots, making them even hotter every time, and she has no plans to stop. Her state of the art walker, the “Pink Flamingo”, is a one of a kind but its design his growing ever more popular within the Mercenary Companies.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, for the Mercenaries. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Concordia: Balearica / Cyprus
Description:
Concordia: Balearica features the Balearic Islands of MAIORICA (Mallorca), MINORICA (Menorca), EBUSUS (Ibiza), and FRUMENTARIA (Formentera).

Each player starts with two ships already at sea. There is no capital city to start from. Land colonists are built only later in the game, but can switch their position between the islands.

As an extra, Concordia: Balearica comes with a fishmarket. The fish market may be combined not only with the new BALEARICA map, but also used as a variant together with the base game or any other CONCORDIA map.

As a new commodity, fish replace the ordinary bonus units you usually collect when playing your Prefect. The bonus is doubled up to 2 fish in provinces that have failed to produce in the last round. Sell your fish on a separate fishmarket, where you can get either goods, cash, or special actions in return. This way the fishmarket offers an extra layer of planning ahead and new challenges for the experienced CONCORDIA player.

The opposite side of this board has the CYPRUS map for all who have missed it when buying Concordia: Venus (Expansion).

-description from publisher

Name: Dust 1947: Raketentruppe Tank-Hunter Squad
Description:
The Luftwaffe Raketentruppe Tank Hunter Squad deals with any armored target the Luftwaffe ground forces might encounter. Thanks to their Bazookas and Panzerfausts, they can engage any heavy tank or walker and blow it to pieces in seconds.

This squad comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card, for the Luftwaffe Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Cthulhu Mythos Cultist Fire Squad
Description:
The Maidens of the Cult are a female-only branch of the Cult of the Great Cthulhu while serving Nyarlathotep and his Avatars. They are the most fanatical and devout worshipers of the Great Old One, second only to the High Priests of the Cult. The Maidens of the Cult’s main task is to guard the secret temples and hidden lairs devoted to the Great Old Ones. They show no mercy to trespassers or anyone who wishes to interfere with their masters' plans.

This squad comes with its own Dust 1947 unit card, for the Mythos Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Loki / Loth (Trop) PanzerKampfLäufer II-C/F
Description:
The Loki is probably one of the deadliest antiaircraft walker in existence. Thanks to its improved open chassis, it can now be found all over the world, anywhere the Axis fights.
The Loth variant is an Engineer and Mechanic walker, always useful to help other walkers get out of dire situations. It is also very common wherever Axis forces are present.
This box will allow you to field one of these two variants.

This item comes with two Dust 1947 Unit Cards, for the NDAK Faction of the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Eysenhudt: Gotteslehrer & Hauptmann
Description:
Eysenhudt is an historical and atmospheric board game, which absorbs you right into the middle of the German Peasants' War (about the year 1525 – the doorstep between the late Middle Ages and the early Modern Era).

As for now, Eysenhudt is available for free as a PnP (Print & Play) game. Look for all the stuff in the Files section.

As a minor leader of the revolutionary movement (in a rather remote theatre of that war) you conduct all sorts of tactical and strategical operations – all with the aim to steer your troops in the best possible way through the excited and exciting (though perilous) times. 
Each round a player chooses one of the six basic Offices: Go, spread the word of the Reformation as a »Prediger« (Preacher) to make the countless »Thorps« (villages) more valuable for the revolution's cause (and to score Victory Points on top of that). As a »Rottmeister« (~ corporal) win over those Thorps – they are your (and your fellow player's) supply bases in food and units. As a »Trossweibel« (Whore's Sergeant) increase the storage volume of your wagon trek to store and transport your Food Barrels and various goods. Gather food as a »Proviantmeister« (Furir) and store the barrels in your wagons. Deploy new units (of various military and diplomatic uses and worth in Victory Points) as a »Werber« (Recruiter). And as a »Beutemeister« (~ purser) you might also want to visit one of the various markets where you can trade your booty into all sorts of useful equipment. These six basic Offices are closely linked together. More variability and depth (historical and tactical) are added by the »Eysenhudt Cards«, which can be chosen instead of an Office. Those cards represent tactical or strategical orders from your captain: Anthonius Eysenhudt. 
After each three rounds you have to perform certain actions during an »Encampment Phase« in which you try to conquer one of the very important fortified towns. For this combat action each player chooses the more defensive »Threatening Attack« or the more aggressive and physical »Storm Attack«. And the decision is crucial, because not only may it decide over the success or failure of the attack, you may also be attracted to act more aggressively in trying to storm the fortified towns (or strongholds) to make all the more booty (and even to increase your gain in Victory Points) but you'll on the other hand receive all the more Aggression Points, which increases the probability of a more severe punishment at the game's end.
Cause in the end your fate lies in the hands of the »Principals' Justice« and you may yet lose much of what you've gained. And the punishment you'll receive reflects on your actions during game play. The decisions are as hard to make as the paths to win Eysenhudt are manifold. Overall the game is more cooperative than competitive. Nonetheless each player has to find his or her own strategy to score as much Victory Points as possible.

—description from the designer

Name: Dwar7s Fall Collector's Edition
Description:
To survive the long and terrible winter, the dwarfs need to prepare. Collect gems, fight monsters, build castles, and stock food. Time is precious, and it is vital to plan your actions wisely!

Dwar7s Fall: Collector's Edition contains:


     The Dwar7s Fall core game
     The Dwar7s Fall: Empires expansion
     The Dwar7s Fall: Royal Decrees expansion
     Game board
    Pre-painted meeples

Name: Dwar7s Fall: Dragon's Forge Expansion
Description:
Dragon Forge, an expansion for Dwar7s Fall, can be added along with any other expansion of the game and it works with any number of players.

It takes decades to hatch a dragon egg... and then years to train a dragon. But in the end, you have a formidable ally to create magical weapons and go into battle!

Dragon's Forge takes place years after the Empires expansion. Place the volcano starting tiles at the middle of the board. Then, beg the dragons to transform your precious gems into dragon glass. Use dragon glass and the ogres to help the blacksmith forge epic weapons!

But beware...

Dragons have been seen marching upon our lands!

Name: Nazo-toki Book: Akuma no tegata
Description:
~ Mystery Solving Book: The Devil’s Handprint ~

„If you decipher the ancient document, a door will open...” – This book is composed of such riddles. All the stories are connected, and the cases progress as the mysteries are being solved. Then eventually, a grandiose final mystery emerges!
One player becomes the questioner. They read the mystery aloud, then draws a card with a picture on it, and shows it to the other players. The card contains clues related to the cases. The clues can be instant hints, or have an importance later on. If you give a wrong answer, you might get an unexpected reply from the questioner. The questioner’s turn goes clockwise.
The main component of the game is a book, which attempts to evoke an atmosphere similar to that of mystery TPRG’s and escape games. The book counts 52 pages, with 8 mysteries to solve. Playtime is about 60~90 minutes. Difficulty is easy, and basically anyone can play it (all the kanji learnt above elementary 6th grade has furigana attached). However, the stories gradually get harder and harder towards the end.
A free demo is available for download on the official homepage.

Name: Chicken -n- Waffles
Description:
Each player is dealt an equal number of hands of four cards each (quantity depending upon the number of players). An additional hand of four are placed face-up in the center of the play area. Turns happen in real-time and simultaneously with players exchanging only one card from one hand with a card from the pool in the center of the table. Players may only have one hand active at a time in their hand and must lay any others down on the table face-down. When discarding a card to the center to trade, players must call out the name of the animal they are laying down. If it is a pig, instead of yelling "Pig", they say "Waffles", the pig's name.

If a player has both a chicken and Waffles in their hand, they may discard them both to pick up two cards instead of the normal one, exclaiming "Chicken -n- Waffles!"

The goal is to get all your hands to have matching four-of-a-kind sets with the exception of the chicken and Waffles cards - these must be paired up  with matching features (color of clothes) and combined with any other pair of animals. The round winner chooses another animal to add to the deck and plays the next round with an additional hand of cards. When playing with four hands (having won one), you may not use the wilds. When you win a second round, you may use wilds again, but must play the rest of the game one-handed. The first player to win three rounds is the overall winner.

In a 6 player game, you play until you win two rounds, with the previous middle round (not being able to use wilds) ignored.

—description from the designer

Name: Revelación
Description:
Revelación is an exploratory and memory eurogame along with tactical and strategic overtones. Players assume the role of one of ten intrepid explorers, each with their unique abilities, to venture into the immemorial forest and discover its ancient secrets. They will have to face each other (a lot), to cover themselves with glory once they find the three relics.
Players move freely around the board, trying to discover and memorize scattered objects throughout the forest.


[Spanish]

Revelación es un eurogame de exploración y memoria, con tintes táctico-estratégicos. Los jugadores asumirán el rol de uno de diez intrépidos exploradores, cada cual con sus habilidades únicas, para aventurarse en el tupido bosque inmemorial y descubrir sus antiguos secretos. Habrán de enfrentarse entre sí, sin cuartel, para quedarse con la gloria al encontrar tres de las reliquias pérdidas.

Los jugadores se mueven libremente por el tablero, intentando descubrir y memorizar los objetos dispersos en todo el bosque.

Name: Electronic Movin' Hoops
Description:
It’s a race against the clock with the Rec-Tek Electronic Movin’ Hoops! The fun is nonstop with 2 great game options to choose from! Choose to play as a beginner and leave the moving hoops motor off for an easy straight shot, or choose the Advance mode, turn the motor on, and shoot for the moving hoops for a bigger challenge! How many shots can you sink in 60 seconds?

GAME FEATURES:

Motorized Hoops Move Side to Side for added Excitement
Spring-Shooters Swivel so you can Score from any angle
LED Scoring Automatically Tracks the Action
Real Stadium Sounds make you feel like you’re in the game
Complete with 8 Mini Basketballs
Set of Game Rules and Instructions
Assembled Dimensions - 28 IN (L) X 7.5 IN (W) X 9 IN (H)

Name: Capital Vices
Description:
Anyone who seeks to lead a virtuous existence knows that sin lies everywhere. In Capital Vices, you are a new resident of the Capital trying to coexist in a community where food and money are limited but the temptation to sin abounds. Careful distribution of these resources is the path to virtue, but beware: your actions are not without consequence. Every operation may help the individual’s spiritual progress at the expense of the whole… or vice-versa. Avoid the seven deadly sins, embrace the seven heavenly virtues, and you’ll be victorious!

In Capital Vices players take actions in order to distribute colored resources of food and money. Doing so will earn you virtues but be sure not to generate a sin penalty! Ending a round with sin will omit you from scoring that round. Have the most virtue and earn a bonus point. The first player to have 7 points at the end of a round is the winner.

Name: ハニーフェスタ (Honey Festa)
Description: Honey Festa is a game where players compete to claim the title of Honey Champion for this year's Honey Festa. Players each have their own fields (board) and a leader pawn from which they send out numbered workers in five colors. When the sum of workers in a color group is exactly 8, the workers plant fields of that color. Certain combinations of fields allow the player to place a token in honey factories, and the player who makes the most honey is declared Honey Champion!

Name: Strange Sites
Description:
Humans have been gathering around sacred sites for ages, and you and a university colleague have created an alogrithmic artificial intelligence program for your masters thesis that scours the internet for information about Alien contact with earth, only to discover that the subjects of many historical pieces, and even modern art pieces are painted with the subject being a location of Alien contact. On top of this you discover that there are actually multiple different races of Aliens, that have contacted our planet, waiting for our response to see which side we will join in the galactic, but the only way to contact them must be through discovering the secret behind these strange sites.

Strange sites is a two player game where players are racing to discover the sites of alien contact, and place their meeples onto them, in an attempt to be the first human to successfully make first contact. Each player is given an opportunity to choose a faction, and change it later, then both players investigate locations, and trigger their unique effects to help them speed towards victory. Using a 4x3 grid of randomized locations, players must search for powerful locations, without giving away information, using clever strategies and efficient choices to be the fastest one to victory!

—description from the publisher

Name: Treachery of the Paper Fox
Description:
Treachery of the Paper Fox is an 18 card game where an Origami Fox is trying to chase paper birds. Each player is trying to collect a set of 4 of the same paper animals, or 4 of the same colour of paper lanterns, where the Fox blends in as a wild, except two Foxes together become useless. Players must try and manage the cards in their hand, to best collect the set they think will win them the game, but also keep track of what information their opponents have given, so as to not give away free points.

Treachery of the Paper Fox features a cute paper themed design style, featuring Origami forest dwelling animals, and paper lanterns, making it a light game and a visual treat.

-description from designer

Name: Scrabble: Milk Chocolate Edition
Description:
"A tasty game for family and friends"

In this variation on the classic game of Scrabble, players choose 4 tiles (instead of 7), each of which is double sided. All other rules are the same such as scoring (e.g. double letter, triple word etc). The board however is slightly smaller (9x9 instead of 15x15) and the game is a lot quicker.

Contents:
- 20 milk chocolates
- playing board

Note: European edition - The letter values of this Scrabble edition may vary from the original game.

Name: Monopoly: The Lion King Edition
Description:
Celebrate Simba's journey to become King with this Monopoly: the Lion King edition game. Players move around the game board as their favorite Lion King character, buying as many pride lands themed properties as they can. The game board features artwork inspired by the Lion King motion picture And comes with 6 character tokens. The more A player owns, the more rent they can collect from other players. The last player with money when all other players have gone bankrupt wins! The Lion King themed edition of the Monopoly game makes a great gift for fans of the Disney movie and is a fun choice to play on family game night.

Features:
Disney the lion King themed game board: this edition of the Monopoly game features a game board with artwork inspired by the lion King movie; players can imagine Simba's journey to become King
Includes 6 character tokens: the Monopoly: Lion King edition game comes with 6 tokens; fans of Disney the lion King can play as Timon, Simba, nala, mufassa, Pumbaa, or Scar.

Pride rock plays music: pride rock holds the destiny cards and plays music.

Features memorable moments and locations from the movie: the title Deed cards are made up of unforgettable moments and locations from Disney the lion King movie.

Includes Destiny cards: Destiny cards replace chance cards and community chest cards in this version of the Monopoly game, and they are inspired by the lion King movie.

Name: Monopoly: Huddersfield
Description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
MONOPOLY, the great property trading board game, finds its home in the historical town of Huddersfield: from award-winning Victorian architecture to Iron Age monuments. Journey around the gameboard with Huddersfield Cabs and explore landmarks including: Lindley Clock Tower, the Town Hall and Huddersfield Golf Club. Don't forget to stop off for some refreshments en route at Dixons Milk Ices or Beaumont Park. You can further relax while watching the Huddersfield Giants play rugby, or take in some culture at the Choral Society. Take a spin around this beautiful market town and perhaps you'll own your favourite location, or discover a hidden gem in "God's Own County"!

Name: Third Man
Description: Similar to Twelve Men's Morris, this game was marketed in the late 1960s to emphasize the survival mechanism of three pieces.

Name: Dust 1947: Cobra/Rattler
Description:
The Mickey chassis has been the first walker ever available for the Allies Bloc, thanks to the cunning of Joe Brown and the incredible engineering skills of Rosie Donovan. At first using weapons adapted from regular tanks, it's now up-gunned with latest technology weapons: the dreaded Cobra mounts a powerful Phaser gun capable of dealing with any armored threat, while the Rattler can blow any aircraft from the sky with ease.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants, in either regular or amphibious configuration.

This reference comes with four Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, amphibious or not, all for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Fireball/Punisher – Super Heavy Walker
Description:
The Punisher is equipped the heaviest guns mounted on any Allied vehicle on the planet. A single shot from these can turn any armored unit into smoldering heaps of metal. The Fireball possess an incredible flamethrower that can melt any target, and several at the same time if they are aligned! Both these walkers can transport a full squad of soldiers and a hero and are armed with an amazing array of machineguns.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Allied Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Natalya/Nadya/Natasha
Description:
KV-47 walkers are the most common within the large armies of the SSU: robust, reliable and tough, they can be equipped with a variety of weapons, adapted for each mission. The Natasha has two grenade launchers, efficient against infantry and light vehicles. The Nadya can melt anything thanks to its two flamethrowers and the Natalya shreds everything fool enough to get in range! These three walkers can be transported by a specialized helicopter. This reference allows you to field one of these three variants.

This reference comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards, one per variant, all for the SSU Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Königsluther/Sturmkönig
Description:
The KönigsLuther is a formidable walker, easily among the most fearsome on the planet. The heaviest variant of the Luther, it sometimes wins battles even before firing a shot. Its raw firepower is so terrifying that many enemy tank commanders simply refuse to fight it without heavy support. The SturmKönig fills the air with such a sheer volume of fire that few aircraft can withstand its sustained barrage. Capable of dealing with any kind of threat on the battlefield, it's a favorite of Axis armored regiments all around the World.
This reference allows you to field one of these two variants.

This reference comes with two Dust 1947 unit cards, one for each variant, both for the Axis Bloc. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: Wotan II / FlammLuther II / PanzerKampfLäufer III B/E
Description:
Axis forces are facing more armor and heavy vehicles than ever before. Their enemies have surely caught up! These two up-gunned walkers are among the most powerful on the planet. They will tip the balance and make the Axis Army an unbeatable force once again.

This reference allows you to field one of three different walkers: the Wotan II and its AR variant, and the FlammLuther II. All are available for the Axis Bloc and the BlutKreuz Korps.
The Wotan II, and AR variant, mounts the heaviest Laser weapons available on the planet. It can engage enemy vehicles at great range and reduce them to smoldering heaps of metal in seconds. It also has two machineguns now, one dedicated to anti-infantry fire, the other also able to hit anything that flies.
An unusual weapon pattern for the Axis, the FlammLuther II excel at attacking entrenched enemies. With two flamethrowers, it is deadly to soldiers and can hurt any vehicle it might cross path with. It is also equipped with the same machineguns as the first two variants.

This reference comes with six Dust 1947 unit cards: two for the Wotan II (Axis Bloc & BlutKreuz Korps Faction), two for the Wotan II AR (Axis Bloc & BlutKreuz Korps Faction) and two for the FlammLuther II (Axis Bloc & BlutKreuz Korps Faction). Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dust 1947: PT-47B Plavayushchiy Tank-47
Description:
Developed initially for special operations use, this amphibious troop transport ready vehicle is slowly becoming a staple of SSU forces around the planet. At the moment it can be mostly found with Spetsnaz and PLA forces, which make the most of its capabilities: the PT-47B can go nearly everywhere with a small group of soldiers. This version is equipped with powerful turret weapons that provide great fire support.

This vehicle comes with three Dust 1947 unit cards: one for the SSU Bloc, one for the Spetsnaz Faction and one for the PLA Faction. Like all regular Dust 1947 miniatures, it comes already assembled and primed. It's ready for the battlefield, or for painting, as you wish! You can directly paint over on it, since the priming serves as an undercoat and is compatible with any type of paint.

Name: Dr. Jekyll & Mr. Hyde
Description:
Hidden Identity game based upon "The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde"

Three to six players will secretly draw characters from a bag. All characters are considered "good citizens", except for Dr. Jekyll. Then, proceeding through 6 different stories, each player will draw and play clues based on their secret character. As these clues are played on the game board, players will each take turns going on "holiday", which will add to the suspense of determining who is good and who is hiding their real persona. All players can make accusations after successfully winning stories 4 and 5. Beware though! As Dr. Jekyll can make false accusations to further his transformation!

The good citizens are also attempting to remove chemicals (white substance cubes) from the board to thwart Dr. Jekyll's transformation. Dr. Jekyll will try to play clues of his own to eliminate the citizens and transform himself and escape forever.

Based on Robert Louis Stevenson's novella, "The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde, explore six peculiar incidents while trying to determine who is Dr. Jekyll ...before he escapes as Mr. Hyde! This classic story is the perfect theme for a social deduction game!

—description from the designer
Families: Books: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde

Name: Level Up Loot: One
Description:
Level up your collection of Renegade games with these promo items!

Includes:

Promos:
Altiplano: Sunny Days
Clank!: Trailblazer
FUSE: Tool Box Promo Pack 
Gunkimono: Double Army Tiles
Lotus: Love Me Not Tokens
Reykholt: Startup Financing Promo Pack

Accessories:
Clank!: Sunken Treasures: Sea Dragon Marker
The Tea Dragon Society Card Game: Rooibos First Player marker

Name: Lotus: Loves Me Not Tokens
Description:
Four new Loves Me Not Tokens to add to your games of Lotus.

When a flower is completed, if you have control of that flower you may earn one of your Special Power Tokens (or a Scoring Token). If you choose to earn a Special Power Token, you may choose the Loves Me Not Token in your player color.

Once you have the Loves Me Not Token, you may spend one of your actions each turn to pluck any one Petal Card from an incomplete flower in the Lotus Garden.  Remove that Petal Card and place it in your scoring pile.  At the end of the game, that Petal Card will be worth one victory point for you, as normal.

Originally contained in Level Up Loot: One

Name: FUSE: Tool Box Promo Pack
Description:
Four new cards to use in your games of FUSE.

During setup, designate two areas on the playing surface: one for inactive tools cards, and one for active tools cards.  Shuffle the four tool cards, then select two of them at random and place them in the inactive area, face up.  Return the two remaining tools cards to the game box.

During the game, players may allocate their chosen dice to the tools cards in the inactive area.  When all spaces on a tool card are filled with dice, return those dice to the bag and move that tool to the active area.  That tools card can now be used at any time.

To use a tool card, carry out the listed ability, then flip the card face down.  Each card can only be used once a game.

Note: When rerolling the unused dice at the end of a round,  you are never required to remove dice that have been placed on tool cards.

Originally contained in Level Up Loot: One

Name: Gunkimono: Double Army Tiles
Description:
5 new Double Army Tiles.

When dealing out starting hands during setup, deal each player two large army tiles from the stack instead of three.  Then shuffle the five double army tiles and deal one to each player face down.  (Return any remaining, without revealing them to the box)

Each double army tile has the same type of troop on both halves.  Therefore, when the tile is played, both troops are considered part of the same group of troops.

You may choose to play your double army tile on your turn, instead of a standard large army tile or one of your small army tiles.  When you do, you may score both troops for honor points, both for victory or one for honor and one for victory points.

The double army tile counts towards your hand size, this means that you will have two standard large army tiles in hand until you play your double army tile.

Originally contained in Level Up Loot: One

Name: Clank!: Trailblazer Promo Card
Description:
New companion card for Clank!

During setup, shuffle this card into the Dungeon Deck. This card can be used with any clank board but is most effective with the expansion boards.

Text:
This turn, if you take a Curse, enter a flooded room, mine a gold vein, or take a web token, gain 2 gold.

Originally contained in Level Up Loot: One

Name: Are You Patient Zero?
Description: In the social deductive card game Patient Zero, you must figure out who amongst you has first contracted the virus that will eventually turn you into a member of the living dead. The fate of humankind rests in your hands. Thinking of hands, why are your hands shaking? Why is Bobby laughing after everything he says? The virus is spreading fast. Will you survive?

Name: Los Muertos No Hablan: expansión 8 jugadores
Description:
8 players expansion, new cards and new rules.

Includes:
2 player boards
22 new cards
4 life counters

Name: Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Decoration Tiles
Description:
This expansion adds three new decoration tiles to Teotihuacan. These tiles show a special Decoration symbol.

Matching the special Decoration symbol

For purposes of matching the covered icon below it, the special Decoration symbol counts as a generic icon. However, when covering a generic icon, in addition to scoring 1 Victory Point as normal, you may advance on any one temple of your choice.

There are two versions of this expansion. One consists of three cardboard tiles, and came as a promo in the Sierra West box. The other consists of wooden tiles, and also contains wooden tiles to replace the cardboard tiles from the base game.

In 2020, became available as part of the Teotihuacan: City of Gods – Promo Bundle

Name: Middara: Unintentional Malum – Act 2
Description:
The first Adventure Expansion for Middara. Second part of the Unintentional Malum Trilogy.
Unintentional Malum Act 2 contains Adventure Book, Crawl Book, Diagram Book, Plastic Miniatures, new cards plus so much more!

THE STORY CONTINUES
These Adventure Expansions continue Unintentional Malum's epic story. These Expansions contain far more than your typical expansion pack. Each Adventure Expansion gives you a massive amount of content that rivals something close to even our original products that they expand. This is to provide the basis for what Middara is all about, story telling, character growth, and continuity.

Each Adventure Expansion gives you at least 40 additional hours of gameplay by extending not only the Base Game they require, but also the surrounding optional ways of playing Middara, including the Crawl Mode.

NEW LOCATIONS
Each Adventure Pack contains a plethora of beautiful tiles. You'll find airships, exotic floating tombs, deeper levels of the white vaults, and even other worldly locations.

MINIATURES & MONSTERS
The story continues as you take your characters into even higher levels of power and face off against even more dangerous and diverse creatures!
New weird creatures inhabit the world. Learn their lore, learn their weaknesses, and kill them.

MORE CRAWL MODE OPTIONS
Each Adventure Expansion contains a set of unique Crawl Mode adventures to play when you don't have time to enjoy the gigantic story. In addition, you'll find that the Crawl Mode's depth has been optionally expanded and it's balance and options more fine tuned for quick and efficient play for those who want that old school dungeon crawler experience.

Name: Hamburgueria Maluca
Description:
A simple children’s game where you are trying to build your hamburger before every other player.
In your turn you roll a die to determine the movement of a pawn used by all players. The pawn moves around a reach that show ingredients for your hamburger. There are 4 categories of ingredients and you want one of each category. If the pawn end his movements in one ingredient you don’t have, you pick the new ingredient. Otherwise you just pass.
There are also some fields in the track with a roulette symbol. If the pawn stop there you must roll a roulette where you can receive new ingredients, lose some of them or even steal from your opponents.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition): General's Handbook 2019
Description:
An essential tool for all warlords, this book is packed full of new and exciting ways to play Warhammer Age of Sigmar, Second Edition. It is replete with resources for planning and waging epic conflicts, creating varied and interactive battlefields, and amassing deadly and characterful armies.

This edition contains;

     New Open War rule set
     Expanded Hidden Agendas
     A new narrative gaming toolbox, including rules for street fighting, launching raids and ambushes, including mercenary units in your army, and more
     Name generators for a range of factions
     Updated Pitched Battle rules and new Meeting Engagement rules
     An overview of tournament gaming
     Updated allegiance abilities


—description from the publisher

Name: Leyte 1944: A Panzer Grenadier Scenario Book
Description:
Panzer Grenadier: Leyte 1944

In October 1944 American soldiers stormed ashore on the island of Leyte in the Philippines, fulfilling Douglas MacArthur’s promise to return. Japanese troops put up fierce resistance and reinforcements poured in, including elite paratroopers. Not until December would Leyte be secured.

Designer Jay Townsend brought you the battle for Saipan in our game, Saipan 1944 and expanded it in Marianas 1944. Leyte 1944 is an expansion book for Saipan 1944, studying the battle for Leyte in 48 new scenarios. Everything you need to play all 48 scenarios is included with this book and the boxed game Saipan 1944 and the book Marianas 1944 - no other games or supplements are needed to play any of the 48 scenarios.

Leyte 1944 includes 88 new die-cut, silky-smooth playing pieces with additional U.S. Army, Imperial Japanese Army and Special Naval Landing Force pieces: Japanese paratroopers, American paratroopers, flame-throwing Sherman tanks and more.

—description from the publisher

Name: I KNOW IT ALL
Description:
Inspired by a very old game called "Baccalaureate" among Francophones and "Categories" among Anglophones,  I KNOW IT ALL is a board game created with the intent of uniting generations around themes testing their abilities and speed thinking. It presents a familiar universe to the players while remaining original; unlike the games above, we wanted this one more accomplished, more modern, more complex and much more captivating. We know beforehand that it will offer players, families and/or friends a unique experience while they are experiencing intense moments of fun, laughter, and knowledge building.

Geared towards ages 12 and up, I KNOW IT ALL  is a game that tests your global knowledge. The winner is not necessarily the oldest or smartest person at the table, but the one keeping up with the fast pace and thinking on his/her feet.

—description from the designer

Name: Whirl, Spin the Top Game
Description:
A spinning top game distributed under Shackman's name.

I've seen a couple of different boxtops for the game. They all seem to be made in Japan, so I'd guess after WWII, so circa 1950 for the games.

Basically there is a concave bowl which has balls which are knocked in holes with point values along the edge of the bowl area.

—user summary

Simple to perform but with fast interesting action. As top spins balls fly into numbered holes.

Rules:
   One or more can play
   Red ball is double score
   Balls jumping outside game don't count for any score

—description from the box

Name: Rise of Tribes: The Mesa
Description:
Swap with any mountain.

The Mesa still counts as a mountain for goals and events. It produces stone.

On this terrain, the active player must have 3 tribe members before they can Gather from this tile. Once that requirement is met, the Mesa produces the normal amount according to Gather

Name: Donkey Stack Stix Game
Description:
Wooden cutout of a donkey that looks to be about an inch thick. On the donkey's tail is a small circular platform upon which one is to place small sticks that look like small matchsticks.

From the boxtop:


        Each child secures batch of colored sticks and in turn places on donkey circle. 



        Scoring: Person who makes them fall gets nothing, others count sticks of their own color and that is their score. 


Presumably the players would have agreed on some target score to win.

Name: Tower Of Pisa
Description:
A stick stacking game. If you knock down the stack when placing a stick then you lose.

From the boxtop:

        Each player takes one color and places a piece on the pile. When you topple the pile you are out. A game of coordination. 1 to 4 can play.


The base looks sort of like the Washington Monument with a little platform at the top.  The sticks look shaped like matchsticks, perhaps a bit larger.

Name: Baby Dragon Bedtime 2nd Edition
Description:
Like most infants, baby dragons hate going to bed! But now Mumma Dragon has declared it bed time and the dragons haven't got their hoards in order. They'll need to scramble as fast as they can to grab the gold and go to sleep, while making sure they get more gold than their siblings!

Baby Dragon Bedtime is the world's first real-time deckbuilder. Players all act at once to move through their decks to find cards that let them peek at the cards face down on the table and then pull them into their hand - assuming they are valuable gold of course and not dustbunnies!

Play takes only about a minute but players have been known to play for hours. And it makes a great family game as kids and adults can play together.

In this Second Edition, we've changed how some cards work to streamline play and added three new cards which you can add to increase chaos: The Crash, The Swoop and the Mama's Coming! Plus all new incredible art from Luke Parsons.

72 cards plus rules.

Name: Unruly Bastards
Description:
Unruly Bastards is the hilarious party game of competitive inappropriateness. It's simple to learn, insanely fun to play and unique every time.

200 Cards. 10,000 combinations. A lifetime of hilariously unforgettable moments. 3 or more players are recommended. The game is 17+ so rounds can get as unruly as you and your friends choose to be.

You are about to embark upon an epic battle of imagination. Each and every card inside this box has been delicately crafted to create an environment for you and your friends to compete using nothing more than your sense of humor and terrible judgment.

A brief word of warning: This is a game where horrible thoughts are oftentimes rewarded. The more you embrace your inner bastard, the more likely it is that you will be crowned CHAMPION.

That being said, you can play this game as clean or as dirty as you want. In either case, we always recommend that you stop just shy of your friends and family permanently disowning you.

—description from the designer

Name: Tales of the Northlands: The Rings of Nudrug – The 'Thank You' Saga Card
Description:
A single additional Saga card based upon the long forgotten theatrical performance by Birmingham Repertory Theatre in December 1971. The show was scripted by Oliver Postgate and sets and scenery designed by Peter Firmin. The image on the card is a photograph from the stage production.

The Saga card when completed allows all players with at least one Nog on a supply card (on the Rings of Nudrug Saga) to select one character action from any character currently in the castle for no food cost. Players choose in order starting with the first Nog placed on the first supply card completed. Each player may only take this special bonus once regardless of how many of their Nogs are on the supply cards.

This card was not a promotional item and never available as a free giveaway at a convention or with the base game. It was distributed personally by the designer as a thank you to people who made a significant contribution to the game. Card released 1st July 2019.

—description from the publisher

Name: Infinity: Daedalus's Fall
Description:
Rise and fall of the Tohaa! Years ago, the Tohaa arrived on Paradiso to help humanity fight the Combined Army, but they also had a hidden agenda. The Triumvirate, a Tohaa shadow government, is waging a dirty war against the EI in which Paradiso and Humanity are nothing but pawns. Now, the Daedalus Portal that links the Human Sphere with the Tohaa systems has been destroyed, leaving the Tohaa on Paradiso stranded in the Human Sphere and disconnected from their home. Free from interference, the Triumvirate has created Spiral Corps, a mixed mercenary company that serves as a clandestine way to operate within the Human Sphere with total freedom and helps them achieve their goals.

Daedalus’ Fall includes not only the Campaign Rules for Infinity, but also two narrative campaigns: Paradiso Crossroads and Daedalus’ Fall. There are eighteen narrative scenarios that will allow you to recreate events on Paradiso past and present in the Infinity Universe.

This book also includes a wealth of information and background about new Sectorial Armies for Nomads, Haqqislam, the Combined Army, and NA2 with new Mercenary armies like Spiral Corps, The Foreign Company, and the Dahshat Company. Join them and help form part of Infinity’s History!

—description from the publisher

Name: Infinity: Spiral Corps Army Pack
Description:
Spiral Corps is a mixed mercenary company with a core of experts and professional troops from the Tohaa Trident as well as a contingent of human mercenaries offering their experience as alien hunters.

This set contains the miniatures, rules and terrain you need to start collecting a Spiral Corps Sectorial Army and introduce you to the Infinity universe.`

—description from the publisher

Name: Orbital Velocity
Description:
Two countries are coming together to place satellites in orbit. Each rocket has satellites from all countries but only one satellite can be placed into one orbit. Now, each country is trying to place their satellite into the orbit.

This is a 2 or 4 player game.

This is simple space themed family game with a focus on numerical strategy and probabilities. The game is hyper-tactical and lighter on long term strategy. It uses a new game mechanism called "CCPP" (Common Cost, private profit) in "game theory" terms. Most seasoned game testers have found the new mechanism to be "intriguing", although it is not for everyone.

—description from the designer

Name: Bullseye Pizza Chef
Description:
Bullseye Pizza Chef is a dice targeting push you luck dexterity game. You will roll your topping dice at a pizza crust target and see what topping you can score. but be careful not to roll to many cheese or your turn will be over. once you have collected your toppings you can fill pizza orders.

—description from the designer

Name: Concordia Venus: Balearica / Italia
Description:
Concordia: Balearica features the balearic islands of MAIORICA (Mallorca), MINORICA (Menorca), EBUSUS (Ibiza), and FRUMENTARIA (Formentera).

Each player starts with two ships already at sea. There is no capital city to start from. Land colonists are built only later in the game, but can switch their position between the islands.

As an extra, Concordia: Balearica comes with a fishmarket. The fishmarket may be combined not only with the new BALEARICA map, but also used as a variant together with the base game or any other CONCORDIA map.

As a new commodity, fish replaces the ordinary bonus units you usually collect when playing your Prefect. The bonus is doubled up to 2 fish in provinces which have failed to produce in the last round. Sell your fish on a separate fishmarket, where you can get either goods, cash, or special actions in return. This way the fishmarket offers an extra layer of planning ahead, and new challenges for the experienced CONCORDIA player.

The opposite side of this board has the ITALIA map for all who have missed it when buying Concordia Venus.

-description from publisher

Name: Super Awesome Monster Cuddle Party
Description:
Super Awesome Monster Cuddle Party is a throwing card game with physical challenges for 2-6 players.

You’re all awesome monsters who just want to cuddle with the baby monsters! And why wouldn’t you, they’re so cute! So just when you see a baby cuddly monster you all just jump and end up making an amazing monster cuddle pile! The closest monsters get the most baby monster super cuteness and that’s really what everyone wants!

Each round players will throw one of their cards in an attempt to get it closest to the baby card. They will stand behind a marker card which shows an action all players must do as they throw their cards. If a players card lands action-side up the action on the card replaces previous actions and becomes the only action each player must do as they throw their card. If a player's card lands monster-side up they have a chance to win the game! After all players have finished throwing their cards, the player with the closest monster-side up card to the baby monster card wins!

-description from designer

Name: Game of Thrones: Oathbreaker – Jon Snow/Sansa Stark Character Board
Description:
This is an additional character board including Jon Snow on one side and Sansa Stark on the other, given as a pre-order bonus from the publisher's website.

Jon’s ability to “Rally the North” allows his player and two allies to act twice in a round.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire

Name: Conan: Savage Legends
Description: Conan: Savage Legends takes place in Conan's Hyborean Age after the ancient necromancer, Xaltotun, shatters the walls of time and space, stranding heroes and villains alike together in Hyborea. You take on the role of a mighty legend, gather your warband, and go forth to battle other legends torn from space and time. Take command of your forces, gather magical artifacts, acquire power, and remind your foes why you deserve the title of legend.

Name: Transformers Trading Card Game: Blaster vs. Soundwave Set
Description:
The Transformers Trading Card Game is a battling card game designed for two players. Players build a team of Transformers character cards and power them up with a customizable deck of battle cards. Transformers character cards are twice the size of standard playing cards; they can be flipped from bot mode to alt mode and back, and they feature premium printing treatment on one of their sides. The deck of battle cards features Action and Upgrade cards to enhance Transformers character cards.

The Blaster vs. Soundwave Set contains the cards for two players to play these two iconic characters against each other right out of the box.  Included are two large foil character cards (Blaster and Soundwave), 6 small foil character cards (Eject, Ramhorn, Steeljaw, Buzzsaw, Frenzy and Ravage), and two 40 card decks.

Name: Tapage Nocturne
Description:
Tapage Nocturne ("Noise Complaint") is a fast playing reaction game in which your neighbours are organizing a costume party. It is 2 0’clock in the
morning, and noise is increasing due to an ongoing imitation contest...
Listen carefully sounds and indications coming from the app, and smash the right card!
The first one to smash it, wins the card but will have to do the action drawn on the back for the next turn.
When three piles are empty, party is over. Player who got the most cards wins the game.
(exemple of actions: close your eyes during the next turn, modifiy one of the app sound, and so on...)
Noise complaint game requires the use of a smartphone or tablet.

—user summary

Lorsque vos voisins organisent une soirée déguisée alcoolisée chez eux, qu’il est 2h du mat et qu’ils n’ont rien trouvé de mieux que d’organiser un concours d’imitation…
Une envie frénétique de tous les taper vous prend !
Ecoutez les sons diffusés par l’application, les indications du DJ, et soyez le plus rapide !

—description from the publisher

Name: L'osti d'jeu: Bon Cop Bad Cop 2
Description: A promo pack of cards for L'Osti d'jeu release for the first weekend in movie theater of the movie: Bon Cop Bad Cop 2.

Name: Roll to the Rim
Description:
A complete, fast-paced basketball experience with one standard d6 die. Features offensive layups, jump shots, three-point shots, and fouls. Defense is played on all shots other than free throws. A fun game with variable play length based on the time available—simply set the final score higher or lower for longer or shorter games. View instructions in the Files section below.

This game was created with the help of my 3-point shooting niece during a family vacation in Coronado, CA during the week of June 24, 2019.

—description from the designer

Name: Roll-A Golf
Description:
A simple board game along the lines of Shut the Box.

The player has two dice, and 18 golf tees in two colors (9 of each color). The board has two rows of nine holes, one for the front 9, and another row for the back nine. 
—user summary

Start the game with tees of one color in the front 9 holes, and tees of the other color set up in the back nine holes. Play the front 9. Roll the dice. The number showing on the dice determines  which tees you can remove & how many you can remove. For example, if a player throws a total of 7 spots on the dice, he may remove the 5&2, or the 4, 2, & 1, or he may remove the tee in Hole 7. Player must use the entire number found on the dice throw. When a number is thrown, and the player can't remove tees on the front, leave what is left. Go to back 9, throw the dice, and start again. See how you rate. Scores are for the front & back holes combined. 
—description from the rulebook


     0 to 2 tees left - SUPER PRO! 
     3 tees -- Pro. 
     4 to 5 tees left -- So, So. 
     6 or more -- Duffer!"


TRY AGAIN."
—description from the packaging

Name: Middara: Pirates of Elenia Vol.1  – Chasing Legends
Description:
Heists, piracy, and chasing legends. Pirates of Elenia is the first Adventure Pack for Middara: Unintentional Malum.

Adventure Packs are shorter tales that fill in the gaps of the stories from our Base Games. They represent all the stories happening behind the scenes. Each one plays a small part in the overall pictures of our narrative and world. They help to explain not only possible holes in the plot, but also to tie up events that transpire in other products.

While smaller than Adventure Expansions, Adventure Packs contain a significant amount of content. Each one is laden with new miniatures, new Items, new Crawl Mode content, and all the over the top value that you can expect from Succubus Publishing.

What makes our Adventure Packs extra special is their optional rules that can augment the stories that they’re complementing. This comes in the form of new variants for monsters that already exist, new Adventurers for the Crawl Mode, new tiles that expand existing sets, and new Items that can be added to the store and used in our base products.

Adventure Packs use brand new flags that augment other Adventures and they also reference flags used in other Adventures. They’re designed to be played in a chronological order though they can still be played in any order. Pirates of Elenia for example is designed to be played anytime after you’ve finished Chapter 3 of Unintentional Malum.

Pirates of Elenia, Vol. 1 is an Adventure Pack designed for 1-4 players.

Over 15 encounters, more than 20 new miniatures, and a plethora of new items, monsters, and more!

Pirates of Elenia has a whopping 100k+ word narrative, Flags that propagate into UM2 and 3, as well as connections to larger narratives at play!

Requires Unintentional Malum: Act 1 to play.

Story Synopsis:

The Index Phage

Despite the abomination’s presence in all the stories, the legend of The Index Phage had always been more of a wives tale than a real threat to the people of Middara. Even so, widespread rumors pegged this creature as the cause behind the horrible incurable illness called the Blight. This horrific disease had spread all across Elenia like a plague, so to Kajax and his crew, it only made sense that the citizens of Middara would tell themselves tall tales that give themselves hope.
As the legend went, all you had to do was kill The Index Phage and you’d cure the curse of the Blight.

But it was all too convenient, and Kajax knew that they’d be lucky if this monster even existed at all. But the wealth put forth by the richest aristocracies in a desperate attempt at finding a cure was all too real. With a concerning distress call coming in from Hyde, the Arsen family had finally had enough. With all other avenues already exhausted, it was time to chase legends and try the absurd.

Name: Cookie Time!
Description:
Cookie Time! is a fun hand management and set collection game for 2 to 4 players (ages 10 and up). The game takes about 20 to 40 minutes to complete. In this game you are a cookie connoisseur, trying to eat as many different types of cookies as possible to maximize your tasting experience. In addition, every cookie you eat has to be sweeter than the one you just ate.

However, all of your friends are thinking exactly the same way as you do and there are only a limited number of cookies. So think strategically and act fast before all of the tastiest cookies are gone.  Sounds interesting? Now it’s Cookie Time!

In this game, the cookie cards can be placed on the plate to be scored as happiness points later. The cards can also be rotated 180 degrees to become money in the Wallet. On your turn, buy a pair of cards from the market to your hand and discard the money from your Wallet to the discard pile according to the market price card next to it. Then you must play 2 cards from your hand to your playing area, either to Plate or Wallet.

Play continues until there are not enough cards to replenish the market. Add all happiness together and the player with the most happiness is the winner of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Honour Bound
Description:
Basic Outline:

Each player starts with one shogun card, three daimyo cards and five samurai cards. All players also draw five action cards each at the start of the game.

The goal of Honour Bound is to KILL the other opponent's Shogun to have complete reign over feudal Japan and win the game

Phase 1: Selection

Each Player selects a character of their army and places it face down

When both cards are placed down they they are flipped over at the same time

Phase 2: Honour Declaration

Both players roll the dice to determine their base honour level

If you have played a Samurai card then you can roll once. A Daimyo is two rolls and a Shogun is three rolls. The sum of all your rolls are added together to become your base honour level

The player with the lowest honour level is on the defensize

Phase 3: Tactics

Players can place their initial actions cards if any are available, the defensive player places their initial action card first, but the offensive player can also play an initial action card after the defensive player has decided to play theirs or pass their turn

Phase 4: Swordplay

The defensive player must place their active action cards to either increase or decrease their honour level by using a power card, or reduce their opponents honour level by using a protection card

Eevery time a card is played the offensive player has the option to play an action card to counter the defensive player if they wish

This goes on back and forth until a player can no longer defend itself

Once the defensive player can no longer place action cards or chooses not to, they discard their army card into the army discard pile and the offensive player takes their army card back into their deck

Both players then take an action card and phase 1 loops back until a Shogun is killed and the winner is declared

Name: Me, Myself, and Ice Cream
Description:
Me, Myself, and Ice Cream is a light mix-and-match strategy game that can be played as a solitaire game by adults, or cooperatively by kids. You play as a dessert chef working in a kitchen to make the foods desired by your customer.

At the beginning of the game, choose a character to be your customer.

Shuffle the 15 food cards and deal them face up in three columns of five cards each. Then shuffle a standard deck of playing cards and deal six cards into play and draw a starting hand.

To create a food, you match the suits found on the food with the suits on your cards. Then you collect it and feed it to your customer, gaining its sweet reward.

When you can't make a match, you can deal more cards, but be careful not to run of out cards before creating all of the foods that your customer wants.

Once you've created all the foods your friend is hungry for, you win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Starship Troopers Miniatures Game: Roughnecks Army Book
Description: Featured on recruitment adverts throughout the Federation, the Roughnecks have grown into a legend. From their first encounter with the Arachnids on Pluto to the Klendathu Invasion and beyond, the men and women of the Roughnecks have defended the Federation with their lives. Always at the centre of a campaign, the Roughnecks are a veteran unit of the Mobile Infantry. Adept at fighting Arachnids, they are capable of taking on dangerous missions and emerging victorious. The command squad, including Rico, Dizzy, Jenkins and their allies, contains some of the toughest and most experienced troopers found in the Mobile Infantry The Roughnecks has the following sections, detailing this new Mobile Infantry force. Using the Roughnecks: Complete rules for using the Roughnecks in a Mobile Infantry force, allowing you to use these veteran troopers in games of Starship Troopers as either a complete army or part of a much larger force. The Painting Guide: A section packed with photographs of painted Roughnecks bravely battling the enemies of Mankind. Includes a complete painting guide designed to get your own group of Roughnecks onto the table as quickly as possible. Characters: Details the most famous men and women to have served in the Roughnecks. The Roughnecks in Action: Two missions to try your hand at with this elite squad.

Name: World At War 85: Storming the Gap – The Expansion Pack
Description: Here are all the Expansion Packs for World At War 85: Storming the Gap in one box.  This expansion pack contains three complete modules to expand the Storming the Gap game.  The expansions are Defense of Frankfurt, Storm and Steel Second Wave, Drive On Giessen.
Families: Series: World At War 85 (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

Name: Malakatl
Description:
In Malakatl, players will play the role of miners. One of them is trying to extract silver, the other one tuff, both of which make up the national symbol of the Mexican state of Zacatecas. 
The name Malakatl comes from Nahuatl and means winch. It refers to the winch that is used in the mines to lift heavy objects, minerals and water.

The two players must advance at least one of their miners to one of the mines. The other miners will be responsible for selecting the actions, that is, on the board there will be several actions to be carried out, and these actions must be taken by miners, if they are to be carried out. The goal is to extract the tuff or the silver and take them to the center of the board, where the players must build an obelisk which can be made of silver or tuff. But they must be careful not to disturb a sparrow, because by doing so, a mine will be disabled. The goal of the game is to collect as many points and build the obelisk, or make the sparrows settle in the opposite mines.

Name: Ayodya: Tales of Archipelago
Description:
Welcome to the world of fights and collaborations among heroes of Ayodya. The world where everyone strives to be the strongest, the most badass, and the most elusive hero. You can be where the powerful denawa, the swift garuda, the agile wanara, or the uncanny human are.
Clear the path to your victory individually or team up individually or team up with other future opponents. You can be a friendly foe or a deadly opponent, it's up to your strategy, bravery, and luck. So come and have a drink at Ayodya battlefield!

How to Play:
Each player's turn consists of 3 phases:

     Battle phase: A player may confront other players with their Hero card and Gear card placed on the battlefield supported with Battle Phase Skill cards.
     Draw phase: The player takes 2 cards from Card deck (certain Heroes have a skill that boosts the number of cards drawn.
     Preparation phase: Player places, replaces, or stacks Gear cards on the battlefield. The player could also activate Preparation Phase Skill cards.

Name: Thievestown
Description:
Become the Guild Master of your own Thieves Guild! Players will recruit bandits for their cause to pilfer, plunder, and rob. Work the black market to obtain valuable loot and collect gold to prove you're the best guild master of all. But watch out - you're not the only guild in the city. Add some mayhem to your mischief by wheeling and dealing with rival guilds as you try to secure your place in infamy.

Objective: 
Be the guild with the most treasure.

Game Ends: 
After four rounds or once the town has been robbed completely of its money.

Game Play: Each round consists of three phases. 

     Players secretly determines where their guild members will be sent. 
     Buying from the black market, hiring new guild members, and robbing buildings. Players will have to decide when and if they will work together and how to divvy up the loot.  
     Upkeep


Mechanics:
Every character has a combination of lock picking skills(might, magic, and mechanical) based on their level. Roll the dice for each character to break into buildings and retrieve the treasure. But don't take too many thieves as alarm dice are rolled for each figure at the location. If other guilds are present, then you'll have to decide if you want to work together and how you'll split the treasure, or go it alone. Table talk is highly encouraged.

Name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Storybook – We Be Heroes?
Description: We Be Heroes? is a Pathfinder Adventure Card Game adventure designed for starting characters. It requires the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game Core Set to play.
Families: Versions & Editions: Board Game Versions of Role-Playing Games

Name: The Red Dragon Inn: Tainted Tincture
Description:
Free RPG Day 2019 promo card.
Effect: -2 Fortitude

Name: Got You
Description:
Kitty plays hide and seek with rats in the house every day. It seems like an interesting game, but it really scares the rats.
To catch rats, Kitty not only sets straps but also pretends to sleep. To protect themselves while looking for the cheeses, the rats have the choice of working together or acting alone.
Kitty or rats, which role do you want to be?

There are 2 groups during game playing: a player plays as Katy and others play as rats. If Katy catches all the rats, Katy wins. If rats get a big cheese together or some selfish rats get cheese alone, rats win.

There are 4 phases in a round: The Sleeping Phase of Kitty, The Running Phase of Rat, The Running Phase of Kitty and The Tool Phase of Rats.

If Katy or Rats get the Goal of the game, they win immediately.

Name: In Full Bloom
Description:
There are kinds of assortment flowers in four seasons. These flowers and trees interlace with one another become a great landscape. Let’s plant some lovely flowers! Who will design the most colorful sea of flowers?

Every player chooses a set of player markers. The game is played in 2 phases: Collect and Design.

Collect: Choose 3 Garden tiles, place a player marker and draw 3 Garden tiles from the bag.

Design: All players face up their 6 Garden tiles and place these Flower tiles together at the same time.

After all players finished their sea of flowers, the game ends. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Line Up Bees
Description:
Buzz! Let’s work! Queen is the core of the bee society and bees are all busy for her. If we meet other bees, just fight it! Protect your Queen, make your kingdom as long as you can.

Players set up 7 bee cards secretly and face down in a row in the Fight Area. Place a bee card on the Support Area. Players can refer following picture. Note:  Queen could be place in the player area.

In your turn, you can: Roll the dice or Fight.

If player gets 1 of the goal, he/she wins and the game ends:

     If your bumblebee covers on opponent’s Queen.
     The other player can’t pay any more honey.

Name: Firefly
Description:
On warm summer evenings, you, the dancing fireflies light up and appear as sparking lights or long trails. Looking for lustrous stones as the love token to attract your special someone and share together your ephemeral life.

Components
Bush tiles(hexagonal):
• Male firefly tiles x4
• Lustrous stone tiles x8 (1 stonex6 and 2 stonesx2)
• Lantern with one handle tiles x4
• Lantern with two handle tiles x3
• Assigned lantern tiles x4
Player tiles (hexagonal in the 4 player colors)
• Female firefly tiles x4
• Player's lustrous stone tiles x8
• Sparking tiles x4             
• Danger marker tiles x4
• Player marker tiles x4 
• Points and Special tiles (round)
• Round sparking tiles x4
• Round lustrous stone tiles x24 (1 stone x11 and 3 stones x13)

Name: One Key: Card 901
Description:
This is a promo card for One Key, distributed by the publisher at conventions.

Works like any other card and is just added to the other cards.

Name: One Key: Card 902
Description:
This is a promo card for One Key, distributed by the publisher at conventions.

Works like any other card and is just added to the other cards.

Name: One Key: Card 903
Description:
This is a promo card for One Key, distributed by the publisher at conventions.

Works like any other card and is just added to the other cards.

Name: Oceans: The Deep – Promo Pack 2
Description:
This pack contains 6 new foiled promo Deep traits for Oceans and was available as an add-on in the Oceans Kickstarter pledge manager. Later available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter Explorers Pack.

PROMO cards are foiled to let people know they are different from other cards in the Deep. PROMO cards are well-balanced cards, but they are either A) more aggressive, B) more chaotic, or C) more complicated.

These cards were not included with any pledge level, and were not unlocked with stretch goals.

The Deep was designed to be infinitely expandable without throwing off the balance of the game, so you can pick and choose which cards to add to your game.

The Deep traits of Promo Pack 2 are "Hibernation", "Great Migration", "Proliferation", "Blood Bath", "Go Fish", and "Feeding Frenzy".

Name: Oceans: The Deep – Promo Pack 1
Description:
This pack contains 6 new expansion Deep traits for Oceans and was available as an add-on in the Oceans Kickstarter pledge manager as well as Man vs. Meeple Season 3 Promo. Later available during the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter campaign and Tantrum House Season 8.

PROMO cards are well-balanced cards, but they are either A) more aggressive, B) more chaotic, or C) more complicated.

These cards were not included with any pledge level, and were not unlocked with stretch goals.

The Deep was designed to be infinitely expandable without throwing off the balance of the game, so you can pick and choose which cards to add to your game.

The Deep traits of promo pack 1 are "Sea Wyrm", "Fast Life Cycle", "Epizootic Parasite", "Nomadic", "Biome Toxicity", and "Osteodermal Kaiju".

Name: Siste man ut
Description:
The game involves skill and luck picking up game pieces from the game board. The player who succeeds in taking the last winner.

On a game board with holes in a 5x5 large grid, the players take turns to place out the colored game pieces in random order.

On a player's turn they can remove one, two or three game pieces. If more than one game piece is removed, everyone must be in the same row, they must sit next to each other and no one must be of the same color.

—user summary

Name: Full fart
Description:
A simple racing game where you move your racing cars after the dots on the dice. If you land on a red field then a card is drawn and you do what the card says. It can be both negative and positive events. First in goal after three laps wins.

—user summary

Name: Cyblobs
Description:
Mold a blob. Plan your move. The rest is between the eyes!

First, mold the Cyblobs. The biggest and prettiest blob gets eyes and a mouth, the little blobs only one eye. Despite being formable, the Cyblobs are not very agile, they move in straight lines based on dice roll. As they encounter smaller Cyblobs, they steal an eye or eat the whole blob. But you should keep an eye on your own Cyblobs because without atleast one eye, a Cyblob is finished! The biggest Cyblob with the most eyes wins.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Score Five
Description:
The game is played with "X" and "O" plastic pieces on a fold up board with an 8x8 grid of cells. The objective is to score points by making lines of 3 (5 pts), 4 (10 pts),or 5 (15 pts). A line of 6 immediately wins the game. A few of the spaces on the board are penalty spaces and a few are bonus spaces.

—user summary

Name: Järnåldersbönderna
Description:
During the course of the game, you have to acquire different goods in the forest and at the lake which can be exchanged for gold with the trader. The team that first gets a gold climb per participant wins the game.

The players are split into two teams. Each team chooses an iron age farm as the starting point. Then you go out into the iron-age landscape to collect food for their tribal members or obtain goods from the forest and the lake which can then be exchanged for gold at the famous Jämtland market place Frösön. If the game piece lands on a colored spot, it draws a card of the corresponding color and does what the card says. An important part of the game is to always ensure that all tribal members have a food card otherwise the whole tribe can starve and die.

—user summary

Name: Beni's Top 11
Description:
Beni's Top 11 is a football card game created by the Swiss sports reporter Beni Thurnheer. The base game consists of two teams from the Swiss first football league, Grasshopper Club Zürich and FC Luzern, which can be pitched against each other on a tiny game board (a ball is not included, but any coin or other small item can be used). 
Each player shuffles the stack of cards from their teams, which consists of three cards each of 15 players from that team. Then both players flip open the top card from their stack and compare the stats. The winning player (higher number) moves the ball one slot closer to the opponent's goal (or into the goal if the ball is in the box already). Depending on the ball's position, attack or defense values are used. If a player draws the coach, they can choose the stats from one of the three previous cards. After the stack of 45 cards is played through twice (two halves), the player with most goals is the winner.

At least one additional set of cards was released for BSC Young Boys in 1992.
The box credits a G. Meister as well, but whether as artist or co-designer remains unclear.

—user summary

Name: Monster Arena
Description:
Players are monster breeders at the monster breeding academy and have to pitch their creatures against each other in series of three rounds. 
The game begins with a drafting phase. Each player has 3 dueling cards and 9 drafting cards. Out of those nine cards, they add three to their dueling cards and distribute the rest among the other players. The process is repeated with the cards they hold afterwards. 
The players distribute the 12 cards they hold now into three stacks: 3 for the first round, 4 for the second and 5 for the third. During each round, players can choose to reveal some of their cards; for each revealed card, a point token is added to the pool (from the bank). Then players can choose to participate or withdraw. All participating players reveal their remaining cards and the highest total wins the pool (losing players add tokens to the pool). 
This is repeated through rounds two and three, then cards are distributed again. The game ends after the round when someone has gained 50 points.
The strengths of the monsters are often interdependent, so holding certain combinations makes them stronger. To win, players must use these combinations cleverly.

Name: Blue Metal: Tactical Racing
Description:
A race to the finish. Players control their speed by switching between High and Low Gears, drifting around corners, and trying to predict the potential layout of the race track. Every time you move off a Track Card your opponent plays one from their hand, continuing the track until they run out of Track Cards. Once you move off the last Track Card and your opponent has no more left to play, you win.

—description from the designer

Name: Don't DIE Dungeon
Description:
A novel solitaire game of dungeon delving played with a single component: a custom six sided die.  Under the advanced rules, the game contains all the familiar tropes of a hack and slash dungeon crawl: traps, treasure, leveling, secret passages, monsters, magic items, and more.

The advanced rules also contain some strategy and planning along with some of the luck involved in a typical fantasy game with exploration and combat.

Clearly the achievement of the game, though, is to do it all with a single static game component.

—description from the designer

Name: Domina Anthology
Description: This limited-edition boxed set contains Argoat, Miraris, and Pralaya, along with Miraris: Fallen Soul, an exclusive promo card.

Name: Ütle Nüüd
Description:
Ütle nüüd is a social game where the goal is to say the first word. How fast can you say the color starting with V? What about a dog breed starting with a letter P?

For example, if the star card is K and the word card says "City in Estonia" then Keila is the answer. Whoever says the first word can grab the card, the cards are over and the winner is over at the end of the game.

—user summary

Name: Aladdin: The Game
Description:
Travel Agrabah avoiding quicksand, sandstorms, guards and traps on your journey to thwart Jafar's evil plan and set the Genie free! Along the way stop at the Palace, Prison and the Cave of Wonders, gather objects, make wishes and take the Magic Carpet for a spin.
—description from the back of the box

The game involves spinning a 3D Genie spinner to determine movement on your turn. The first to visit all 3 locations (the Prison, the Palace, and the Cave of Wonders) and collect a token from the locations, then reach the end of the game board wins. In your way are Jafar and the Royal Guards, which can block your path. Traps are also laid out across the game board ranging from sand storms, to quick sand, to water traps. Each player has 3 wishes that can be used for a variety of purposes unique to each of the 4 playable characters: Abu, Aladdin, Jasmine, and Rajah. 
—user summary

Name: Contract: Blackboss Promo Card
Description:
A promo card distributed by the publisher at various conventions.

This mafiosi belongs to the Blackmat family and is worth 7 points. It replaces Darkson, the 3 points card of the same family.

Name: Star Wars: Legion – Phase I Clone Troopers Unit Expansion
Description:
The first troops to take the field in the Clone Wars, Phase I Clone Troopers represent a new era of galactic warfare.
